name: plaster
description: A Desktop App for Making Great Podcasts

packageJSON.name: plaster
packageJSON.description: A Desktop App for Making Great Podcasts

scripts.package: npm run deletepackages && npm run buildapp && npm run dist && npm run zippackages

releases.name: Some bug fixes
releases.body:
Episode mp3 files are now deleted when episode is deleted.

ssh private key is now selected with a dialog instead of a text input field.

A few other miscellaneous bug fixes

releases.name: Date and Time UI for episodes
releases.body: In this release, a date picker and time picker were added in order to edit the pubDate for an episode/item

releases.name: Better welcome screen (and downloading
releases.body:
In this release, the folder path for where the podcast is saved is moved to a field in the modal triggered by the welcome screen.

Downloading of podcast images and item enclosures from a remote url is also added.

A few bugfixes are also included.

releases.name: Delete destination file if source is changed
releases.body: Simple fix to stop folders from getting bloated if image or audio files are changed frequently

releases.name: Rethinking some things
releases.body: In this update, we take a new approach to the autoUpdater. It's still not working, but hopefully these changes will make future updates easier.

releases.name: Some Cosmetic Updates
releases.body:
Mostly, this release attempts to finally fix the windows auto-updater issue. In addition
- Better spacing on home screen
- Even spacing in banner when no publish option is set
- Categories are now arranged in two columns

releases.name: Better error-handling, embedded fonts
releases.body:
In this release, some errors get a modal dialog instead of a snackbar.

Also, Roboto is included in the app, so it should appear the same on all platforms.

releases.name: First release with proper squirrel links
releases.body: Hopefully this and all future releases will auto-update on macOS and Windows

releases.name: Slightly Less Broken
releases.body: This release begins to implement auto-updating. It is also code-signed for OSX.

releases.name: The very first release
releases.body: This release is incredibly buggy. Please do not use. This is just an attempt to try to test out the github releases and electron auto-updater stuff.
